summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons internal affairs referral and incident memorandum regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York on August 10, 2019. It details the discovery of Epstein unresponsive in his cell, the emergency response, and admissions from two correctional officers that they failed to conduct required inmate checks (3 a.m. and 5 a.m. rounds) prior to the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found unresponsive in his assigned cell in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead at the hospital.

persons.name: Officer T. Noel
persons.context: Reported the medical emergency and admitted to the Operations Lieutenant that she and another officer did not conduct the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts. Appears distraught and stated 'we messed up'.

persons.name: Officer M.
persons.context: Was performing CPR on Epstein when the reporting official arrived. Also admitted to failing to conduct rounds, stating 'we messed up' and 'I messed up'.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: Spoke with Officers Noel and M. about the incident and their failure to conduct rounds. The person preparing the referral report.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Signed the Referral of Incident form, authorizing the internal affairs investigation.

connections.description: Both were correctional officers assigned to the Special Housing Unit on the night of the incident. They both admitted to failing to conduct required inmate checks together.
Officer Noel was responsible for monitoring inmate Epstein. She discovered him unresponsive and reported the medical emergency.
Officer M. was performing life-saving CPR on inmate Epstein when the reporting official arrived at the cell.
The Operations Lieutenant conducted an initial conversation with Officer Noel regarding the incident and the failure to conduct counts.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York at approximately 6:33 a.m. He was pronounced dead at a local hospital at 7:36 a.m.

events.title: Failure to Conduct Inmate Counts
events.description: Correctional Officers T. Noel and M. admitted to an Operations Lieutenant that they did not conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds in the Special Housing Unit.

events.title: Internal Affairs Referral Initiated
events.description: A formal Referral of Incident (Internal Affairs) was prepared and signed by the Warden, classifying the case for investigation into 'inattentive to Duty' and 'Failure to Follow Policy'.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Special Housing Unit (SHU), Cell Z06-220 on L-tier
Downtown Beekman Hospital (presumably NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, at 6:33 a.m. and was pronounced dead at a hospital at 7:36 a.m.
Two correctional officers, T. Noel and M., admitted to failing to conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds on the night of Epstein's death.
Officer M. was found performing CPR on Epstein when a supervisor arrived at the cell.
The incident was formally referred to the Office of Internal Affairs (OIA) for investigation into 'inattentive to Duty' and 'Failure to Follow Policy'.
The officers involved appeared distraught, stated they were 'traumatized', and wanted to contact their union president before writing any memorandums about the incident.
